title: T205 Collectors: WTT T205's for T206's
author: dougscats

posts.post_title: T205 Collectors: WTT T205's for T206's
posts.post_content:
I'm not giving up on my T205 collection, but for now I am going to subordinate it to my primary goal, the Monster.

So, I count 51 T205's [list and scans below] that I'm offering to trade for T206's, preferably ungraded, in basically the same condition.   

I have about 250 T206's, so I need too many to list.  Let me know what you have available if you want to trade.  Ideally, we'd be trading at least several cards, not to waste too much time and expense on postage.

Most of my T205's are ungraded and range from fair to good, some better, some worse; we can discuss condition when we get down to specific cards.  You might also note when viewing the scans that the cards are under 2 layers of plastic, the plastic page holder and soft sleeves which I've cut in half to make it easier to move them without damaging them--this explains the line that you see near the right-hand borders of the cards.  

I've included the maximum 5 scans.  Contact me at [url]djdoremus@msn.com[/url] and I'll be glad to show you any others/the backs of the cards:

SGC 30/2 John Lobert, American Beauty
SGC 20/1.5 Richard Egan, HLC

Late to the party  - sent PM
